dish_description: The dish is a sauted lamb shoulder chop, seasoned with salt and pepper, accompanied by a garnish of sauted mushrooms and garlic. It is cooked to medium rare and allowed to rest for even juiciness.

cooking_steps.description: Select a shoulder lamb chop with the least amount of fat for a moister and more tender result compared to the loin, and more cost-effective.
Season the lamb chop with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat a skillet and add half a tablespoon of oil and the same amount of butter to saut the lamb chop.
Saut the lamb chop for a few minutes on one side, then lower the heat slightly.
Prepare the mushrooms by washing them, especially if they are a little old, and use them as soon as possible after washing.
Add the mushrooms to the skillet around the lamb chop and cook gently, turning the lamb and mushrooms after a couple of minutes to cook evenly on both sides.
Season the mushrooms with a dash of salt and add sliced garlic towards the end of cooking.
After the lamb chop has cooked to the desired doneness, let it rest off the heat, covered, for 3 to 5 minutes to allow the juices to redistribute for even pinkness from edge to center.
